alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 7:52AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Rio Arriba, Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Rio Grande at Embudo. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor overbank flows are occurring above the Embudo gaging site. Access to riverside picnic facilities above Pilar and below the Taos Junction Bridge along state route 570 will be limited if further rises occur. Other localized effects due to the high water levels will begin to be felt at a stage of 10 feet but no significant flooding is expected until the river rises to 12 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM MDT Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.3 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 1000 PM MDT.

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; Rio Arriba; Santa Fe
